channel.title: Matt's Networking Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Matt's Networking Blog

item.title: Python's ipaddress Module
item.description: Introduction (some familiarity with Python is assumed for this article) Since version 3.3 (released September 2012), Python has included an ipaddress module as part of its standard library (that is, it’s included as part of any default Python 3.3+ installation). For a network engineer, this can be a remarkably useful and easy way to work with IP addresses and subnets in Python. The official documentation is here, but read on for a basic summary of this module and some helpful uses for it.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m Matt Petty, a network engineer in Knoxville, TN, with over 15 years of experience in healthcare IT. My IT career started with help desk and desktop support, but quickly shifted to network engineering, and for the last 10+ years, has focused mainly on network security and services. My primary experience is in the Cisco ecosystem, particulary the Cisco ASA and Sourcefire Firepower Secure Firewall, and many other Cisco acronym soups (AnyConnect, ISE, IOS, NX-OS, WLC, even a little DNA and ACI).

item.title: Second Post - Image Testing
item.description: Second Post This is a post that’s intended to test inserting images into posts. Technical blogs aren’t overly helpful without some pretty pictures. See you next time!

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: Journey Into Blogging Hello world! This is the first test post on my blog.
